author: Pavan Dahat
text:
Three Maoists were killed and four security personnel injured in separate encounters in the restive Bastar region of Chhattisgarh on Saturday.

“Three dead bodies of Maoists were recovered after an encounter at Sendra village in Bijapur district on the Maharashtra-Chhattisgarh border today (Saturday). The number of Maoists killed is likely to increase. Our parties are still inside the operational area and more encounters are expected,” Bastar range Inspector General (IG) of Police, SRP Kalluri said in a statement.

In another incident, three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel were injured when an Improvised Explosives Device (IED) exploded in Dantewada district.
title: 3 Maoists killed in Bastar
